messages.title: Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold another independence referendum next year
messages.content: Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold another independence referendum next year, and Jeremy Corbyn has said his Labour Party won’t even stand in the way of one taking place. So this election could be our last chance to stop that referendum, but to do that we all need to send Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP a message they can’t ignore.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stand firm against the SNP’s plans for another divisive independence referendum
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We voted to stay in the Union.
Maintain a full range of services in both Cupar and St Andrews hospitals.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Support Agriculture, Tourism, Fishing, and St Andrews University
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure these sectors thrive in our modern dynamic environment.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only one vote on Thursday 12th December can make Nicola Sturgeon listen and stop the threat of another independence referendum.

issues.economy: End the Parliamentary stalemate and get the nation moving again.
issues.governance: Stand firm against the SNP’s plans for another divisive independence referendum.
issues.health: Invest in primary NHS care and maintain a full range of services in both Cupar and St Andrews hospitals.

community.content: Make sure that Agriculture, Tourism, Fishing and St Andrews University can thrive in our modern dynamic environment.

contactInformation.address: Hill House, Haig Business Park, Balgonie Road, Markinch, KY7 6AQ.

quotes.text: CORBYN ACCUSED OF PLOT TO BREAK UP BRITAIN
Corbyn could back new indyref ‘as early as 2021’
